meanings.definition: To mesh together or become intertwined.
meanings.sent1: The gears were intermeshing smoothly in the machine.
meanings.sent2: The dancers' movements intermeshed perfectly during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were intermeshing so tightly, it took hours to separate them.
meanings.sent4: Their ideas intermeshed like a beautiful tapestry, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The vines intermeshing on the fence created a stunning pattern.

meanings.definition: The act of interlocking or fitting together closely.
meanings.sent1: The intermeshing of the gears was crucial for the clock to work.
meanings.sent2: The intermeshing of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to solve.
meanings.sent3: The intermeshing of flavors in the dish created a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: The intermeshing of branches in the forest formed a dense canopy.
meanings.sent5: The intermeshing of colors in the painting gave it depth and richness.
